1.title: Everything's Mangoes
1.plot: Ivan arrives from Venezuela, but there's no room in the Venezuelan share house where he hoped to stay. He meets Scott and Tia who invite him to stay on their couch, but he finds their language quite puzzling.

2.title: Livin' La Vida Sofa
2.plot: The couch at Scott and Tia's house is uncomfortable, and possibly infested with crabs. Ivan goes to several housemate interviews, but none of them work out. He returns to Scott and Tia's with bedding and a black eye.

3.title: Dead Horse
3.plot: Scott's going to Bunnings and invites Ivan to go too. Ivan has never heard of it so Tia insists on taking him and buying him a sausage sizzle. Ivan's initially reluctant but starts to come around when tomato sauce is added.

4.title: El Grande Outdoors
4.plot: Ivan goes camping with Scott and Tia. Tia won't let him take delicious Venezuelan food; Scott's not allowed to take his coffee machine; Tia is banned from taking her mobile phone. Ivan is the only one who follows the rules.

5.title: The Real Decoy
5.plot: Walking through the park with Scott and Tia, Ivan discovers that, lacking the crime gangs and armed robbers in Venezuela, Australians are instead afraid of magpies.

6.title: Full Antonio
6.plot: Ivan's wish comes true - he is offered an open mike spot at a comedy venue. But he needs to take two paying guests along, and Scott and Tia are both busy that night. Desperate times call for desperate measures.

imdb.plot outline: This is a series of six 6-8 minute shorts co-written by and starring Venezuelan stand-up comedian Ivan Aristeguieta. As Ivan discovers what it means to be a real 'Aussie', his quest to becoming a permanent resident isn't so much about ticking a box on a form, but learning about the strange and unique customs that we take for granted, and that make Australians what they are. With the help of two Aussie roommates, a lesbian tradie (Lori Bell) and hipster vegan (Nick Kreig), Ivan gets a firsthand insight into modern Australia. In the current climate of being an immigrant, what it takes to being one of the 'good ones' and how lucky Ivan feels that he has chosen Australia to visit.
imdb.title: Lost in Pronunciation
plot: _Lost in Pronunciation_ (qv) follows the arrival in Australia of a Venezuelan comedian, Ivan, whose heart is set on breaking into the local comedy scene.

This is a series of six 6-8 minute shorts co-written by and starring Venezuelan stand-up comedian Ivan Aristeguieta. As Ivan discovers what it means to be a real 'Aussie', his quest to becoming a permanent resident isn't so much about ticking a box on a form, but learning about the strange and unique customs that we take for granted, and that make Australians what they are. With the help of two Aussie roommates, a lesbian tradie (Lori Bell) and hipster vegan (Nick Kreig), Ivan gets a firsthand insight into modern Australia. In the current climate of being an immigrant, what it takes to being one of the 'good ones' and how lucky Ivan feels that he has chosen Australia to visit.
